name: Teamwork
description: I work well with teams both large and small, I'm friendly and helpful

name: Motivation
description: I love web development work, it's a dream job

name: Learning
description: I'm always willing to learn new things, in fact it's the biggest proponent of why I love Development

name: Frameworks
description: Larvel and other frameworks are amazingly handy and I've used a fair amount of them.

name: HTML5
description: I've been learning HTML since way back when I used notepad for coding.

name: CSS3
description: A fundamental block of design and something that every developer needs to know.

name: SCSS & LESS
description: Programatic CSS is the greatest thing to have happened to CSS. I've been working with this for a long time now and have improved greatly.

name: Javascript & ES6
description: One of the easiest scripting languages that just keeps getting better. I started with the basics and Jquery, and I've been learning ES6 recently.

name: PHP
description: The fastest server side language to get a project up and running. This is the most used skill I have.

name: C#
description: One of the first programming languages I learned and something that holds a place in the heart of how I program.

name: SQL
description: Database languages are both easy and incredibly powerful. Learning how to use them is one of the most important things every developer should do.

name: Java
description: A language that I've quickly picked up due to knowledge of other languages. It's uses are great but I haven't had much time to get familiar with it.

name: React
description: One of the 'newest' technologies out there as of this time (Dating myself, yes I know). I'm quickly picking it up as it's incredibly easy to learn

name: Windows XP-10
description: Been using this since I'm a kid. I have a complete understanding of how to use this OS and how to troubleshoot it.

name: Mac OSX+
description: Picked this up in my design days in college since everyone used it. Incredibly easy thanks to how user friendly the environment is.

name: Ubuntu
description: Probably the least stressful version of linux I've used. I have some experience in other distros, but this one is very handy to know.

name: Visual Studio 2008
description: Used this in college a lot and haven't picked it up in awhile. I still have knowledge on how to use it however.

name: Unity
description: I've used this for many tiny projects that haven't seen the light of day in a long time.

name: Flash
description: The first thing I learned in college. It's not used much anymore, for good reason, but it has it's place for animators and small indie games.

name: Photoshop & Illustrator
description: Photoshop and Illustrator are probably the best tools for editing and refining images, text and way way more. I've used it since I first started in development.

name: Maya
description: A 3D program I've used for modeling assets for classes and personal projects

name: Intellij IDEA
description: My first true IDE that I've used. This is the environment I was using for learning Java.
